fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom
Class FileSet

Object
  FileSet

public class FileSet
extends Object

File set read from or to be written to a DICOMDIR file.

A FileSet contains a root directory.

A directory contains records.

A record may contain a set of attributes, may point to a file containing a DICOM object, and may contain a subdirectory (lower level directory).

Constructor Detail

FileSet

public FileSet(File f,
               DicomReader reader)
        throws IOException
Constucts a FileSet by reading a DICOMDIR file.

Warnings occuring during reading are forwarded to the warning listeners registered in reader. reader may be null if warnings are not to be processed.

Throws:
IOException

FileSet

public FileSet(String id)
Constructs an empty FileSet that can later be filled with the add(java.io.File, fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom.DicomReader) method and written with the write(java.io.File) method.

Parameters:
id - User or implementation specific identifier (16 chars max, optional)

FileSet

public FileSet(String id,
               File descriptor,
               String charset)
        throws UnsupportedEncodingException
Constructs an empty FileSet that can later be filled with the add(java.io.File, fr.apteryx.imageio.dicom.DicomReader) method and written with the write(java.io.File) method.

Parameters:
id - User or implementation specific identifier (16 chars max, optional)
descriptor - A file included in the file set that contains comments about the file set
charset - The character set the descriptor file is encoded with. DICOM or Java charactet set names can be used. If null, the descriptor file must only contains characters from the basic (ASCII) set.
Throws:
UnsupportedEncodingException
Method Detail

add

public void add(File f,
                DicomReader reader)
         throws IOException
Adds a file to the file set. The metadata of the file will be read using the supplied DicomReader.

Supported SOP class :

  • Detached Patient Management Storage
  • Detached Study Management Storage
  • Any image Storage

Throws:
IOException

add

public void add(File f,
                DicomMetadata dmd,
                String ts)
         throws DicomException
Same as add(File, DicomReader) but the metadata and the transfer syntax are supplied instead of read from the file.

Throws:
DicomException

setEnforceFileIDRestrictions

public void setEnforceFileIDRestrictions(boolean enforce)
Enforce standard File ID restrictions when writing. The DICOM strandard specified that file ID (file path) in file sets must contain 1 to 8 components (path components), and each component must be a string of 1 to 8 characters among A-Z (uppercase), 0-9 and _ (See PS 3.10). By default the write(java.io.File) method will throw an exception if files added to this set does not comply to these restrictions. Calling setEnforceFileIDRestrictions with a false parameter will prevent such exception to be thrown. Be aware that DICOMDIR files created without enforcing file ID restrictions may not be standard and may not be read successfully by other implementations. Furthermore, the length of each component is still limited to 16 characters due to the CS value representation of File Ids. If a path component has more than 16 characters, it will be silently truncated.

write

public void write(File dir)
           throws IOException
Write a DICOMDIR file describing this file set. The file will we written in the directory specificied. The File references in this file set will be translated into file id relative to the specified directory. If the file set references some file that are not below this directory or does not comply to the DICOM specifications for File IDs, a DicomException (code ApplicationError) is thrown. See setEnforceFileIDRestrictions(boolean) to bypass checks on file IDs.

Throws:
IOException
